alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264 (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 3:40PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Apache and Navajo Counties near Keams Canyon through 515 PM MDT/415 PM MST/... At 439 PM MDT/339 PM MST/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Keams Canyon, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Keams Canyon, Low Mountain, Jadito, Jeddito and Navajo. This includes State Route 264 between mile markers 396 and 413. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Black Mesa Area; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264
